content: Australian actress **Khym Lam** (born 1963 or 1964) is a [Singaporean-born Australian](/wiki/Singaporean_Australians) actress. ## Early life Lam was born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) to a Malayan father and a Eurasian mother—her grandparents were Charles Davis, a Welsh engineer who married May Lawrence, a part-Chinese woman, before [World War II](/wiki/World_War_II). Lam and her family moved to Australia when she was aged seven. She studied film-making in Melbourne, while waitressing and taking acting roles to support her studies. ## Career In 1987, Lam appeared in *[The Henderson Kids II](/wiki/The_Henderson_Kids)* as Vietnamese schoolgirl Anh Nguyen, a love interest for main character Steve Henderson. Lam's breakthrough role came in 1988 when she was cast as the female lead role of Julie Soong in the [Network Ten](/wiki/Network_Ten) drama miniseries *[Tanamera – Lion of Singapore](/wiki/Tanamera_%E2%80%93_Lion_of_Singapore)*. She also had a lead role as Yoshie in the 1987 Australian horror film *[Zombie Brigade](/wiki/Zombie_Brigade)*. In 1991, Lam played the Shitsu Tonka Newsreader in the [ABC TV](/wiki/ABC_TV_(Australian_TV_channel)) [Doug Anthony All Stars](/wiki/Doug_Anthony_All_Stars) comedy series *[DAAS Kapital](/wiki/DAAS_Kapital)*. In 1994 and 1995, she appeared in several episodes of *[Neighbours](/wiki/Neighbours)* as [Ling Mai Chan](/wiki/Ling_Mai_Chan), the daughter of [Lou Carpenter](/wiki/Lou_Carpenter). Lam has also worked as a producer on ABC travel documentary *[Race Around the World](/wiki/Race_Around_the_World)*. In 1998, Lam wrote a recipe book, *Eating In: a Post Modern Posthaste Experience*, which was published by [Hodder Headline](/wiki/Hodder_Headline). After studying a Graduate Diploma in Library and Information Management from [TAFE NSW](/wiki/TAFE_NSW) from 2009 to 2011 and gaining a Bachelor of [Arts from RMIT](/wiki/Royal_Melbourne_Institute_of_Technology), Lam has worked in the legal industry, having worked at [MinterEllison](/wiki/MinterEllison) and [Sparke Helmore Lawyers](/wiki/Sparke_Helmore_Lawyers). ## Personal life Lam met [Doug Anthony All Stars](/wiki/Doug_Anthony_All_Stars) member [Richard Fidler](/wiki/Richard_Fidler) while working on *[DAAS Kapital](/wiki/DAAS_Kapital)*. They went on to marry in 1993 and had a son and a daughter. ## Filmography ### Film YearTitleRoleNotes1987*[Zombie Brigade](/wiki/Zombie_Brigade)*Yoshie ### Television YearTitleRoleNotes1987*[The Henderson Kids II](/wiki/The_Henderson_Kids)*Ahn Nguyen12 episodes1989*[The Magistrate](/wiki/The_Magistrate_(miniseries))*Passport OfficerMiniseries, 2 episodes*The Saint in Australia*RaeleenTV movie1989–1992*[Tanamera – Lion of Singapore](/wiki/Tanamera_%E2%80%93_Lion_of_Singapore)*Julie SoongMiniseries, 7 episodes1990*[The Flying Doctors](/wiki/The_Flying_Doctors)*Lou1 episode*[Flair](/wiki/Flair_(miniseries))*MiraMiniseries, 2 episodes1990–1992*[Embassy](/wiki/Embassy_(TV_series))*Lily / Josie2 episodes1991*[All Together Now](/wiki/All_Together_Now_(1991_Australian_TV_series))*Rita1 episode*[Boys from the Bush](/wiki/Boys_from_the_Bush)*MaleeSeason 1, episode 1: "The Stuffed Platypus"1991–1992*[DAAS Kapital](/wiki/DAAS_Kapital)*Shitsu Tonka Newsreader14 episodes1992*[Chances](/wiki/Chances_(TV_series))*Maya1 episode1994–1995*[Neighbours](/wiki/Neighbours)*[Ling Mai Chan](/wiki/List_of_Neighbours_characters_introduced_in_1994)8 episodes1995*Singapore Sling: Midnight Orchid*Theresa LiuTV movie1997*[Water Rats](/wiki/Water_Rats_(TV_series))*Dr Young1 episode - Khym Lam at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier))
title: Khym Lam
